title: kvkapiR
code: library(kvkapiR)

title: kvkapiR
text: access KvK API, need API key. can apply API key learn different KvK APIs KvK Developer Portal.

title: kvkapiR
text: need API key current session, use kvk_set_api_key() function. ‚ö†Ô∏è Note: sets key current R session. key lost restart R.
code: kvk_set_api_key(api_key = "your_api_key_here")

title: kvkapiR
text: want store API key permanently, use kvk_store_api_key() function. saves key .Renviron file, making persist across R sessions. update existing API key, set overwrite parameter TRUE: ‚ö†Ô∏è Important: must restart R changes take effect. ‚ö†Ô∏è Warning: use method can safely store API key system.
code: kvk_store_api_key(api_key = "your_api_key_here") kvk_store_api_key(api_key = "your_new_api_key", overwrite = TRUE)

title: kvkapiR
text: KvK provides test environment can experiment API using production. information available KvK documentation page. functions kvkapiR support testing mode via test_environment argument, set FALSE default. ü¶Ü Tip: test environment contains fictional data based characters Dutch comic magazine ‚ÄúDonald Duck‚Äù. Try searching names like ‚ÄúDonald‚Äù ‚ÄúDagobert‚Äù see API works sample data.

title: kvkapiR
text: kvk_search() function wrapper KvK Search API. automatically paginates results (1,000 records). examples demonstrating perform searches handle API responses.

what: Example 1: single variable, less then 1.000 records
title: kvkapiR
text: Lets search KvK registrations village Koudum. Since small village fewer 1.000 registered businesses (API limit), records retrieved one request.
code: koudum <- kvk_search(plaats = "Koudum") koudum #> # A tibble: 510 √ó 6 #>    kvkNummer vestigingsnummer naam                     adres        type  links  #>    <chr>     <chr>            <chr>                    <list>       <chr> <list> #>  1 01036576  000007810083     Stichting Gemeenschapsc‚Ä¶ <named list> neve‚Ä¶ <list> #>  2 92692966  000032358083     M. de Boer               <named list> neve‚Ä¶ <list> #>  3 60112891  000045511098     Corriente 't Kofjeh√∫ske  <named list> neve‚Ä¶ <list> #>  4 40005051  000021251479     Bogerman                 <named list> neve‚Ä¶ <list> #>  5 30168016  000057781184     It F√ªgeln√™st             <named list> neve‚Ä¶ <list> #>  6 01123666  000040288196     Winterberging IJzendoorn <named list> hoof‚Ä¶ <list> #>  7 58496505  000027833429     HFK Verhuur              <named list> hoof‚Ä¶ <list> #>  8 62724843  000031708129     De Klink Exploitatie B.‚Ä¶ <named list> hoof‚Ä¶ <list> #>  9 01091668  000000678279     Multiservice Beheer en ‚Ä¶ <named list> hoof‚Ä¶ <list> #> 10 41005555  000021707499     Stichting Jongerenwerk ‚Ä¶ <named list> hoof‚Ä¶ <list> #> # ‚Ñπ 500 more rows

what: Example 2: single variable, more then 1.000 records
title: kvkapiR
text: city Rotterdam significantly larger Koudum. Searching registrations Rotterdam return 1,000 records, exceeding API limit. happens, warning displayed:

Only the first 1000 will be retrieved. rotterdam #> # A tibble: 1,000 √ó 6 #>    kvkNummer vestigingsnummer naam                     adres        type  links  #>    <chr>     <chr>            <chr>                    <list>       <chr> <list> #>  1 30019112  000022201726     Albron Campus Catering   <named list> neve‚Ä¶ <list> #>  2 41126601  000023151153     Albert Schweitzer Groep‚Ä¶ <named list> neve‚Ä¶ <list> #>  3 24483298  000023336749     Klooster Afrikaander     <named list> neve‚Ä¶ <list> #>  4 34360247  000022666397     UWV WERKbedrijf Rotterd‚Ä¶ <named list> neve‚Ä¶ <list> #>  5 24483298  000022493352     Gemeentewerken Rotterda‚Ä¶ <named list> neve‚Ä¶ <list> #>  6 24104827  000020343264     Simonis Verf B.V.        <named list> neve‚Ä¶ <list> #>  7 24335233  000010150471     Shop Rosie               <named list> neve‚Ä¶ <list> #>  8 24483298  000022962077     GGD Rotterdam-Rijnmond   <named list> neve‚Ä¶ <list> #>  9 34238535  000060066164     Lev√©o Groep B.V.         <named list> neve‚Ä¶ <list> #> 10 27295998  000059996013     Temporary Works Design ‚Ä¶ <named list> neve‚Ä¶ <list> #> # ‚Ñπ 990 more rows

title: kvkapiR
text: package abbility retrieve three types profielen API: basisprofiel vestigingsprofiel naamgeving examples use test invironment.
code: donald <- kvk_search(naam = "Donald", test_environment = TRUE) #> ‚Ñπ You are using the KvK test environment. Test data will be returned.

title: kvkapiR
text: kvkapiR package provides simple yet powerful interface searching KvK API R. built-authentication handling, test environment support, flexible query options, streamlines access Dutch business registration data. details, refer official KvK API documentation.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Coen Eisma. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Eisma C (2025). kvkapiR: R Wrapper Dutch Chamber Commerce API. R package version 0.0.0.9004, https://coeneisma.github.io/kvkapiR/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {kvkapiR: An R Wrapper for the Dutch Chamber of Commerce API},   author = {Coen Eisma},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9004},   url = {https://coeneisma.github.io/kvkapiR/}, }

what: An R Wrapper for the Dutch Chamber of Commerce API
title: An R Wrapper for the Dutch Chamber of Commerce API
text: goal kvkapiR provide convenient R programming language interface Dutch Chamber Commerce (KvK) APIs. package built using httr2 package follows best practices wrapping APIs R, outlined httr2 documentation. simplifies authentication, request handling, response parsing interacting KvK API. Currently, package provides access following KvK APIs: KvK Search API KvK Basisprofiel API KvK Vestigingsprofiel API KvK Naamgeving API details can found developers website KvK.

title: An R Wrapper for the Dutch Chamber of Commerce API
text: can install development version kvkapiR GitHub : install latest development version:
code: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("coeneisma/kvkapiR") # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("coeneisma/kvkapiR", ref = "development")

title: An R Wrapper for the Dutch Chamber of Commerce API
text: basic examples demonstrating use kvk_search() function retrieve KvK registrations: can also combine multiple search parameters: See vignette("kvkapiR") examples information usage package.

‚Ñπ 499 more rows library(kvkapiR)  rotterdam <- kvk_search(naam = "huisartsen", plaats = "Rotterdam") rotterdam #> # A tibble: 200 √ó 7 #>    kvkNummer vestigingsnummer naam       adres        type  links  vervallenNaam #>    <chr>     <chr>            <chr>      <list>       <chr> <list> <chr>         #>  1 24475068  000009219072     Wijkprakt‚Ä¶ <named list> hoof‚Ä¶ <list> <NA>          #>  2 81943938  000048204625     Jans Huis‚Ä¶ <named list> hoof‚Ä¶ <list> <NA>          #>  3 24477358  000010787356     Van Schai‚Ä¶ <named list> hoof‚Ä¶ <list> <NA>          #>  4 24484189  000016351312     Sanitas H‚Ä¶ <named list> neve‚Ä¶ <list> <NA>          #>  5 97110795  000062375466     Dante Hui‚Ä¶ <named list> hoof‚Ä¶ <list> <NA>          #>  6 66346339  000034979034     Huisartse‚Ä¶ <named list> hoof‚Ä¶ <list> <NA>          #>  7 62380281  000031391419     Huisartse‚Ä¶ <named list> hoof‚Ä¶ <list> <NA>          #>  8 54446538  000024210382     Huisartse‚Ä¶ <named list> hoof‚Ä¶ <list> <NA>          #>  9 24484189  000036373648     Sanitas H‚Ä¶ <named list> hoof‚Ä¶ <list> <NA>          #> 10 85464007  000051508060     itj huisa‚Ä¶ <named list> hoof‚Ä¶ <list> <NA>          #> # title: Analyse kvkapiR Package
text: Gebruik van native pipe (|>) Moderne httr2 library voor API calls Tidyverse-compatible output (tibbles) Lifecycle badges voor API stabiliteit

title: Analyse kvkapiR Package
text: Duidelijke, Nederlandse foutmeldingen met cli package Test environment met Donald Duck data Automatische paginering voor grote resultaten Graceful error handling met NULL returns

title: Analyse kvkapiR Package
text: Alle functies hebben roxygen2 documentatie Praktische voorbeelden bij elke functie Uitgebreide vignette met use cases Duidelijke README met quickstart

title: Analyse kvkapiR Package
text: Consistente functienamen met kvk_ prefix Logische parameter namen Test environment parameter voor development Veilige API key opslag via environment variables

title: Analyse kvkapiR Package
code: # DESCRIPTION aanpassen - missende dependencies Imports:      httr2,     jsonlite,     dplyr,     tidyr,     purrr,      # <-- toevoegen     cli,        # <-- toevoegen     tibble,     # <-- toevoegen     lifecycle  # Bestandsnaam fixen # Van: kvk_retreive.R # Naar: kvk_retrieve.R

title: Analyse kvkapiR Package
text: Voeg testthat tests toe:
code: # tests/testthat/test-kvk_search.R test_that("kvk_search works with test environment", {   result <- kvk_search(plaats = "Utrecht", test_environment = TRUE)   expect_s3_class(result, "tbl_df")   expect_true("kvkNummer" %in% names(result)) })  test_that("kvk_search handles no results gracefully", {   result <- kvk_search(plaats = "NonExistentPlace", test_environment = TRUE)   expect_null(result) })

previous_headings: Wat zou ik verbeteren? üîß > 3. Code Verbetering üíª
what: A. Helper functie voor error handling:
title: Analyse kvkapiR Package
code: handle_kvk_error <- function(e, resource_name) {   status_code <- extract_status_code(e$message)      error_messages <- list(     "400" = "Bad request. The parameters provided are invalid.",     "401" = glue::glue("Unauthorized. Your API key is missing or invalid, or you don't have access to the {resource_name}."),     "403" = "Forbidden. You don't have permission to access this resource.",     "404" = "No results found.",     "429" = "Too many requests. You have exceeded the rate limit.",     "500" = "Internal server error. The KVK API is experiencing issues.",     "503" = "Service unavailable. The KVK API is currently unavailable."   )      message <- error_messages[[as.character(status_code)]] %||%               glue::glue("Error retrieving {resource_name}: {e$message}")      if (status_code == 404) {     cli::cli_alert_info(message)   } else {     cli::cli_warn(message)   }      return(NULL) }

previous_headings: Wat zou ik verbeteren? üîß > 3. Code Verbetering üíª
title: Analyse kvkapiR Package
code: validate_kvk_nummer <- function(kvk_nummer) {   if (!grepl("^[0-9]{8}$", kvk_nummer)) {     cli::cli_abort("KvK nummer moet 8 cijfers zijn. Ontvangen: {kvk_nummer}")   } }  validate_vestigingsnummer <- function(vestigingsnummer) {   if (!grepl("^[0-9]{12}$", vestigingsnummer)) {     cli::cli_abort("Vestigingsnummer moet 12 cijfers zijn. Ontvangen: {vestigingsnummer}")   } }

previous_headings: Wat zou ik verbeteren? üîß > 4. Performance Verbeteringen üöÄ
title: Analyse kvkapiR Package
code: # Simple in-memory cache kvk_cache <- new.env(parent = emptyenv())  kvk_get_basisprofiel_cached <- function(kvkNummer, ..., cache_duration = 3600) {   cache_key <- paste0("basisprofiel_", kvkNummer)   cached <- kvk_cache[[cache_key]]      if (!is.null(cached) && (Sys.time() - cached$time) < cache_duration) {     return(cached$data)   }      result <- kvk_get_basisprofiel(kvkNummer, ...)   kvk_cache[[cache_key]] <- list(data = result, time = Sys.time())   return(result) }

title: Analyse kvkapiR Package

what: Export KvK API usage data ‚Äî kvk_export_usage
title: Export KvK API usage data ‚Äî kvk_export_usage
text: Export usage data CSV file external analysis record keeping.

title: Export KvK API usage data ‚Äî kvk_export_usage
code: kvk_export_usage(file = NULL, format = c("tidy", "monthly"))

title: Export KvK API usage data ‚Äî kvk_export_usage
text: file Character string, path export file. NULL (default), exports "kvk_usage_YYYY-MM-DD.csv" current directory. format Character string, data format export: "tidy": Raw usage data (one row per API call) "monthly": Monthly aggregated data

title: Export KvK API usage data ‚Äî kvk_export_usage
text: Character string path exported file (invisible).

title: Export KvK API usage data ‚Äî kvk_export_usage
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Export to default filename kvk_export_usage()  # Export to specific file kvk_export_usage("my_usage_data.csv")  # Export monthly summary kvk_export_usage(format = "monthly") } # }

what: Retrieve the Basisprofiel for a given KvK number ‚Äî kvk_get_basisprofiel
title: Retrieve the Basisprofiel for a given KvK number ‚Äî kvk_get_basisprofiel
text: function retrieves basis profile given KvK number (kvkNummer) using KvK Basisprofiel API. Users can also request additional data, owner information, main establishment, locations specifying include parameter.

title: Retrieve the Basisprofiel for a given KvK number ‚Äî kvk_get_basisprofiel
code: kvk_get_basisprofiel(   kvkNummer,   geoData = FALSE,   include = NULL,   test_environment = FALSE )

title: Retrieve the Basisprofiel for a given KvK number ‚Äî kvk_get_basisprofiel
text: kvkNummer string representing KvK number basis profile requested. geoData logical value indicating whether geo-data included response. Defaults FALSE. TRUE, response include geo-data. include character vector specifying additional data include. Possible values: "eigenaar" (owner), "hoofdvestiging" (main establishment), "vestigingen" (locations). Defaults NULL (basic profile ). test_environment logical value indicating whether use test environment (TRUE) production environment (FALSE). Defaults FALSE.

title: Retrieve the Basisprofiel for a given KvK number ‚Äî kvk_get_basisprofiel
text: tibble containing retrieved basis profile. geoData = TRUE, returned tibble also include geographical information.

title: Retrieve the Basisprofiel for a given KvK number ‚Äî kvk_get_basisprofiel
text: function also supports test_environment argument. set TRUE, function query KvK test API environment, providing set fictitious test data. function retrieves data KvK Basisprofiel API. geoData = TRUE, geo-data (e.g., location data) included returned profile. include parameter allows users request additional details, ownership information business locations. Important: test_environment = TRUE, actual API key required. using test data KvK test environment.

title: Retrieve the Basisprofiel for a given KvK number ‚Äî kvk_get_basisprofiel
code: # Examples using the production API (requires API key) if (nzchar(Sys.getenv("KVK_API_KEY"))) {   # Retrieve basis profile for a given KvK number without geo-data   basis_profile <- kvk_get_basisprofiel(kvkNummer = "69599084")   print(basis_profile)      # Retrieve basis profile with geo-data   basis_profile_geo <- kvk_get_basisprofiel(kvkNummer = "69599084", geoData = TRUE)      # Retrieve basis profile including owner information   basis_profile_owner <- kvk_get_basisprofiel(kvkNummer = "69599084", include = "eigenaar") } #> # A tibble: 1 √ó 10 #>   kvkNummer indNonMailing naam     formeleRegistratieda‚Ä¶¬π materieleRegistratie‚Ä¶¬≤ #>   <chr>     <chr>         <chr>    <chr>                  <chr>                  #> 1 69599084  Nee           Flexmet‚Ä¶ 20180302               20170914               #> # ‚Ñπ abbreviated names: ¬π‚ÄãformeleRegistratiedatum, #> #   ¬≤‚ÄãmaterieleRegistratie$datumAanvang #> # ‚Ñπ 6 more variables: materieleRegistratie$datumEinde <chr>, #> #   totaalWerkzamePersonen <int>, handelsnamen <list>, sbiActiviteiten <list>, #> #   links <list>, `_embedded` <list>  # Examples using test environment (no API key required) # These use the KvK test dataset with Donald Duck themed businesses basis_profile_test <- kvk_get_basisprofiel(kvkNummer = "68727720", test_environment = TRUE) #> ‚Ñπ You are using the KvK test environment. Test data will be returned. print(basis_profile_test) #> # A tibble: 1 √ó 11 #>   kvkNummer indNonMailing naam     formeleRegistratieda‚Ä¶¬π materieleRegistratie‚Ä¶¬≤ #>   <chr>     <chr>         <chr>    <chr>                  <chr>                  #> 1 68727720  Ja            Test NV‚Ä¶ 20170516               20160516               #> # ‚Ñπ abbreviated names: ¬π‚ÄãformeleRegistratiedatum, #> #   ¬≤‚ÄãmaterieleRegistratie$datumAanvang #> # ‚Ñπ 6 more variables: totaalWerkzamePersonen <int>, statutaireNaam <chr>, #> #   handelsnamen <list>, sbiActiviteiten <list>, links <list>, #> #   `_embedded` <list>

what: Retrieve the Naamgeving for a given KvK number ‚Äî kvk_get_naamgeving
title: Retrieve the Naamgeving for a given KvK number ‚Äî kvk_get_naamgeving
text: function retrieves name information (naamgeving) given KvK number (kvkNummer) using KvK Naamgevingen API.

title: Retrieve the Naamgeving for a given KvK number ‚Äî kvk_get_naamgeving
code: kvk_get_naamgeving(kvkNummer, test_environment = FALSE)

title: Retrieve the Naamgeving for a given KvK number ‚Äî kvk_get_naamgeving
text: kvkNummer string representing KvK number name information requested. test_environment logical value indicating whether use test environment (TRUE) production environment (FALSE). Defaults FALSE.

title: Retrieve the Naamgeving for a given KvK number ‚Äî kvk_get_naamgeving
text: tibble containing retrieved name information.

title: Retrieve the Naamgeving for a given KvK number ‚Äî kvk_get_naamgeving
text: function also supports test_environment argument. set TRUE, function query KvK test API environment, providing set fictitious test data. function retrieves data KvK Naamgevingen API. Important: test_environment = TRUE, actual API key required. using test data KvK test environment.

title: Retrieve the Naamgeving for a given KvK number ‚Äî kvk_get_naamgeving
code: # Examples using the production API (requires API key) if (nzchar(Sys.getenv("KVK_API_KEY"))) {   # Retrieve naamgeving for a given KvK number   naamgeving <- kvk_get_naamgeving(kvkNummer = "68750110")   print(naamgeving) } #> # A tibble: 1 √ó 5 #>   kvkNummer naam     startdatum vestigingen links      #>   <chr>     <chr>    <chr>      <list>      <list>     #> 1 68750110  Bikerfix 20170512   <list [1]>  <list [2]>  # Examples using test environment (no API key required) naamgeving_test <- kvk_get_naamgeving(kvkNummer = "68727720", test_environment = TRUE) #> ‚Ñπ You are using the KvK test environment. Test data will be returned. print(naamgeving_test) #> # A tibble: 1 √ó 7 #>   kvkNummer rsin      statutaireNaam         naam  startdatum vestigingen links  #>   <chr>     <chr>     <chr>                  <chr> <chr>      <list>      <list> #> 1 68727720  857567433 Test NV Katrien - Sta‚Ä¶ Test‚Ä¶ 20160516   <list [1]>  <list>

what: Retrieve the Vestigingsprofiel for a given establishment number ‚Äî kvk_get_vestigingsprofiel
title: Retrieve the Vestigingsprofiel for a given establishment number ‚Äî kvk_get_vestigingsprofiel
text: function retrieves establishment profile (vestigingsprofiel) given establishment number (vestigingsnummer) using KvK Vestigingsprofiel API.

title: Retrieve the Vestigingsprofiel for a given establishment number ‚Äî kvk_get_vestigingsprofiel
code: kvk_get_vestigingsprofiel(   vestigingsnummer,   geoData = FALSE,   test_environment = FALSE )

title: Retrieve the Vestigingsprofiel for a given establishment number ‚Äî kvk_get_vestigingsprofiel
text: vestigingsnummer string representing establishment number profile requested. geoData logical value indicating whether geo-data included response. Defaults FALSE. TRUE, response include geo-data. test_environment logical value indicating whether use test environment (TRUE) production environment (FALSE). Defaults FALSE.

title: Retrieve the Vestigingsprofiel for a given establishment number ‚Äî kvk_get_vestigingsprofiel
text: tibble containing retrieved establishment profile. geoData = TRUE, returned tibble also include geographical information.

title: Retrieve the Vestigingsprofiel for a given establishment number ‚Äî kvk_get_vestigingsprofiel
text: function also supports test_environment argument. set TRUE, function query KvK test API environment, providing set fictitious test data. function retrieves data KvK Vestigingsprofiel API. geoData = TRUE, geo-data (e.g., location data) included returned profile. Important: test_environment = TRUE, actual API key required. using test data KvK test environment.

title: Retrieve the Vestigingsprofiel for a given establishment number ‚Äî kvk_get_vestigingsprofiel
code: # Examples using the production API (requires API key) if (nzchar(Sys.getenv("KVK_API_KEY"))) {   # Retrieve vestigingsprofiel for a given establishment number   vestigingsprofiel <- kvk_get_vestigingsprofiel(vestigingsnummer = "000038509504")   print(vestigingsprofiel)      # Retrieve vestigingsprofiel with geo-data   vestigingsprofiel_geo <- kvk_get_vestigingsprofiel(     vestigingsnummer = "000038509504",      geoData = TRUE   ) } #> # A tibble: 1 √ó 15 #>   vestigingsnummer kvkNummer indNonMailing formeleRegistratiedatum #>   <chr>            <chr>     <chr>         <chr>                   #> 1 000038509504     70215065  Ja            20171204                #> # ‚Ñπ 11 more variables: materieleRegistratie <tibble[,1]>, #> #   eersteHandelsnaam <chr>, indHoofdvestiging <chr>, #> #   indCommercieleVestiging <chr>, voltijdWerkzamePersonen <int>, #> #   totaalWerkzamePersonen <int>, deeltijdWerkzamePersonen <int>, #> #   handelsnamen <list>, adressen <list>, sbiActiviteiten <list>, links <list>  # Examples using test environment (no API key required) vestigingsprofiel_test <- kvk_get_vestigingsprofiel(   vestigingsnummer = "000019716893",    test_environment = TRUE ) #> ‚Ñπ You are using the KvK test environment. Test data will be returned. #> ‚Ñπ The product cannot be delivered for branch number '000019716893' (HTTP 404) print(vestigingsprofiel_test) #> NULL

what: Reset KvK API usage statistics ‚Äî kvk_reset_usage
title: Reset KvK API usage statistics ‚Äî kvk_reset_usage
text: Remove stored API usage data. action undone.

title: Reset KvK API usage statistics ‚Äî kvk_reset_usage
code: kvk_reset_usage(confirm = TRUE)

title: Reset KvK API usage statistics ‚Äî kvk_reset_usage
text: confirm Logical, require confirmation deleting (default: TRUE). Set FALSE skip confirmation prompt.

title: Reset KvK API usage statistics ‚Äî kvk_reset_usage
text: Logical, TRUE data successfully reset, FALSE otherwise.

title: Reset KvK API usage statistics ‚Äî kvk_reset_usage
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Reset with confirmation prompt kvk_reset_usage()  # Reset without confirmation (use with caution) kvk_reset_usage(confirm = FALSE) } # }

what: Retrieve all results from the KvK Search API (up to 1,000 results) ‚Äî kvk_search
title: Retrieve all results from the KvK Search API (up to 1,000 results) ‚Äî kvk_search
text: function automatically paginates KvK API collect available results. Due API limitations, retrieves maximum 1,000 records. happens, warning displayed.

title: Retrieve all results from the KvK Search API (up to 1,000 results) ‚Äî kvk_search
code: kvk_search(..., test_environment = FALSE)

title: Retrieve all results from the KvK Search API (up to 1,000 results) ‚Äî kvk_search
text: ... Named arguments passed API query (e.g., naam = "Koudum"). Available arguments can found https://developers.kvk.nl/documentation/zoeken-api#input. test_environment logical value. TRUE, uses test environment instead live API. Defaults FALSE.

title: Retrieve all results from the KvK Search API (up to 1,000 results) ‚Äî kvk_search
text: tibble containing retrieved results. Possible parameters can found Results section https://developers.kvk.nl/documentation/zoeken-api#output.

title: Retrieve all results from the KvK Search API (up to 1,000 results) ‚Äî kvk_search
text: test_environment = TRUE, switches KvK's test environment, using mock API key testing purposes.

title: Retrieve all results from the KvK Search API (up to 1,000 results) ‚Äî kvk_search
code: # Examples using the production API (requires API key) if (nzchar(Sys.getenv("KVK_API_KEY"))) {   koudum <- kvk_search(plaats = "Koudum")   print(koudum)      rotterdam <- kvk_search(plaats = "Rotterdam")   print(rotterdam) } #> # A tibble: 510 √ó 6 #>    kvkNummer vestigingsnummer naam                     adres        type  links  #>    <chr>     <chr>            <chr>                    <list>       <chr> <list> #>  1 01036576  000007810083     Stichting Gemeenschapsc‚Ä¶ <named list> neve‚Ä¶ <list> #>  2 92692966  000032358083     M. de Boer               <named list> neve‚Ä¶ <list> #>  3 60112891  000045511098     Corriente 't Kofjeh√∫ske  <named list> neve‚Ä¶ <list> #>  4 40005051  000021251479     Bogerman                 <named list> neve‚Ä¶ <list> #>  5 30168016  000057781184     It F√ªgeln√™st             <named list> neve‚Ä¶ <list> #>  6 01123666  000040288196     Winterberging IJzendoorn <named list> hoof‚Ä¶ <list> #>  7 58496505  000027833429     HFK Verhuur              <named list> hoof‚Ä¶ <list> #>  8 62724843  000031708129     De Klink Exploitatie B.‚Ä¶ <named list> hoof‚Ä¶ <list> #>  9 01091668  000000678279     Multiservice Beheer en ‚Ä¶ <named list> hoof‚Ä¶ <list> #> 10 41005555  000021707499     Stichting Jongerenwerk ‚Ä¶ <named list> hoof‚Ä¶ <list> #> # ‚Ñπ 500 more rows #> ! API response contains more than 1000 results. Only the first 1000 will be retrieved. #> # A tibble: 1,000 √ó 6 #>    kvkNummer vestigingsnummer naam                     adres        type  links  #>    <chr>     <chr>            <chr>                    <list>       <chr> <list> #>  1 30019112  000022201726     Albron Campus Catering   <named list> neve‚Ä¶ <list> #>  2 41126601  000023151153     Albert Schweitzer Groep‚Ä¶ <named list> neve‚Ä¶ <list> #>  3 24483298  000023336749     Klooster Afrikaander     <named list> neve‚Ä¶ <list> #>  4 34360247  000022666397     UWV WERKbedrijf Rotterd‚Ä¶ <named list> neve‚Ä¶ <list> #>  5 24483298  000022493352     Gemeentewerken Rotterda‚Ä¶ <named list> neve‚Ä¶ <list> #>  6 24104827  000020343264     Simonis Verf B.V.        <named list> neve‚Ä¶ <list> #>  7 24335233  000010150471     Shop Rosie               <named list> neve‚Ä¶ <list> #>  8 24483298  000022962077     GGD Rotterdam-Rijnmond   <named list> neve‚Ä¶ <list> #>  9 34238535  000060066164     Lev√©o Groep B.V.         <named list> neve‚Ä¶ <list> #> 10 27295998  000059996013     Temporary Works Design ‚Ä¶ <named list> neve‚Ä¶ <list> #> # ‚Ñπ 990 more rows  # Examples using test environment (no API key required) test_data <- kvk_search(plaats = "Utrecht", test_environment = TRUE) #> ‚Ñπ You are using the KvK test environment. Test data will be returned. print(test_data) #> # A tibble: 24 √ó 6 #>    kvkNummer naam                     adres        type  links  vestigingsnummer #>    <chr>     <chr>                    <list>       <chr> <list> <chr>            #>  1 59581883  Kamer van Koophandel     <named list> rech‚Ä¶ <list> NA               #>  2 90000218  Stichting Global Hotsol‚Ä¶ <named list> rech‚Ä¶ <list> NA               #>  3 90006631  Soud'Or B.V.             <named list> rech‚Ä¶ <list> NA               #>  4 92040373  Facility Manager         <named list> rech‚Ä¶ <list> NA               #>  5 90006712  VoorUBO B.V.             <named list> rech‚Ä¶ <list> NA               #>  6 92040292  Sociale werkplaats       <named list> rech‚Ä¶ <list> NA               #>  7 92040322  Woningbouwer             <named list> rech‚Ä¶ <list> NA               #>  8 59581883  Kamer van Koophandel     <named list> hoof‚Ä¶ <list> 000015063097     #>  9 90000633  Stichting Grand Bigelec‚Ä¶ <named list> hoof‚Ä¶ <list> 990000552513     #> 10 90004574  Grand Alphaway B.V.      <named list> hoof‚Ä¶ <list> 990000066710     #> # ‚Ñπ 14 more rows

what: Set KvK API Key for the current session ‚Äî kvk_set_api_key
title: Set KvK API Key for the current session ‚Äî kvk_set_api_key
text: function sets specified KvK API key current R session using Sys.setenv(). key available session ends.

title: Set KvK API Key for the current session ‚Äî kvk_set_api_key
code: kvk_set_api_key(api_key)

title: Set KvK API Key for the current session ‚Äî kvk_set_api_key
text: api_key string containing API key.

title: Set KvK API Key for the current session ‚Äî kvk_set_api_key
text: Invisibly returns TRUE key set.

title: Set KvK API Key for the current session ‚Äî kvk_set_api_key
text: function sets API key using Sys.setenv(), making available current session. However, persist across sessions. want store key permanently, use kvk_store_api_key().

title: Set KvK API Key for the current session ‚Äî kvk_set_api_key
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Set the API key for the current session kvk_set_api_key("abcd1234") } # }

what: Store KvK API Key in .Renviron for persistent use ‚Äî kvk_store_api_key
title: Store KvK API Key in .Renviron for persistent use ‚Äî kvk_store_api_key
text: function saves specified KvK API key .Renviron file, making persist across R sessions. API key already stored, must set overwrite = TRUE replace .

title: Store KvK API Key in .Renviron for persistent use ‚Äî kvk_store_api_key
code: kvk_store_api_key(api_key, overwrite = FALSE)

title: Store KvK API Key in .Renviron for persistent use ‚Äî kvk_store_api_key
text: api_key string containing API key. overwrite logical value indicating whether overwrite existing API key entry .Renviron. Defaults FALSE.

title: Store KvK API Key in .Renviron for persistent use ‚Äî kvk_store_api_key
text: Invisibly returns TRUE key added updated.

title: Store KvK API Key in .Renviron for persistent use ‚Äî kvk_store_api_key
text: function modifies .Renviron store API key permanently. key exists overwrite = FALSE, returns error. key exists overwrite = TRUE, replaces existing key. key exist, appends new API key entry .Renviron. Important: must restart R changes take effect.

title: Store KvK API Key in .Renviron for persistent use ‚Äî kvk_store_api_key
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Store the API key persistently kvk_store_api_key("abcd1234")  # Overwrite an existing API key kvk_store_api_key("newkey5678", overwrite = TRUE) } # }

title: Set usage alert thresholds ‚Äî kvk_usage_alert
text: Configure alerts API usage exceeds specified thresholds. Alerts shown calling kvk_usage_report().

title: Set usage alert thresholds ‚Äî kvk_usage_alert
code: kvk_usage_alert(   max_calls = NULL,   max_cost = NULL,   period = c("month", "year", "total") )

title: Set usage alert thresholds ‚Äî kvk_usage_alert
text: max_calls Integer, maximum number API calls alert. Set NULL disable call limit alert. max_cost Numeric, maximum cost euros alert. Set NULL disable cost limit alert. period Character string, period limits: "month": Limits apply per calendar month "year": Limits apply per calendar year "total": Limits apply -time usage

title: Set usage alert thresholds ‚Äî kvk_usage_alert
text: NULL (invisible). Alerts stored options.

title: Set usage alert thresholds ‚Äî kvk_usage_alert
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Set monthly limit of 100 calls kvk_usage_alert(max_calls = 100, period = "month")  # Set yearly cost limit of EUR50 kvk_usage_alert(max_cost = 50, period = "year")  # Set both limits kvk_usage_alert(max_calls = 500, max_cost = 25, period = "month")  # Disable alerts kvk_usage_alert(max_calls = NULL, max_cost = NULL) } # }

what: Generate KvK API usage report ‚Äî kvk_usage_report
title: Generate KvK API usage report ‚Äî kvk_usage_report
text: Display summary KvK API usage associated costs. function provides insights API consumption patterns helps track expenses.

title: Generate KvK API usage report ‚Äî kvk_usage_report
code: kvk_usage_report(   format = c("summary", "tibble", "tidy"),   year = NULL,   monthly_fee = 6.2,   cost_per_query = 0.02 )

title: Generate KvK API usage report ‚Äî kvk_usage_report
text: format Character string specifying output format: "summary" (default): Display formatted summary console "tibble": Return usage data tibble monthly aggregation "tidy": Return usage data tidy format (one row per API call) year Integer, specific year filter (default: NULL shows years). monthly_fee Numeric, monthly API key connection fee euros (default: 6.20) cost_per_query Numeric, cost per paid query euros (default: 0.02)

title: Generate KvK API usage report ‚Äî kvk_usage_report
text: Depends format parameter: format="summary": NULL (invisible), displays summary console format="tibble": tibble monthly usage statistics format="tidy": tibble individual API calls

title: Generate KvK API usage report ‚Äî kvk_usage_report
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Display usage summary for current year kvk_usage_report()  # Get usage data as tibble usage_tibble <- kvk_usage_report(format = "tibble")  # Get raw usage data in tidy format usage_tidy <- kvk_usage_report(format = "tidy")  # Show all historical data kvk_usage_report(year = NULL) } # }

what: kvkapiR: An R Wrapper for the Dutch Chamber of Commerce API ‚Äî kvkapiR-package
title: kvkapiR: An R Wrapper for the Dutch Chamber of Commerce API ‚Äî kvkapiR-package
text: Provides convenient interface Dutch Chamber Commerce (KvK) API. package built using `httr2` package follows best practices wrapping APIs R, outlined httr2 documentation (https://httr2.r-lib.org/articles/wrapping-apis.html). simplifies authentication, request handling, response parsing interacting KvK API.

title: kvkapiR: An R Wrapper for the Dutch Chamber of Commerce API ‚Äî kvkapiR-package
text: Maintainer: Coen Eisma coeneisma@gmail.com (ORCID)

what: Convert a nested list to a tibble ‚Äî list_to_tibble
title: Convert a nested list to a tibble ‚Äî list_to_tibble
text: function takes nested list converts tibble. element list becomes separate column tibble. nested list contains atomic elements equal length, transformed tibble. Otherwise, stored list-column.

code: list_to_tibble(lst)

title: Convert a nested list to a tibble ‚Äî list_to_tibble
text: lst named list converted tibble.

title: Convert a nested list to a tibble ‚Äî list_to_tibble
text: tibble element list represented column. Nested lists uniform atomic elements converted tibbles, lists stored list-columns.
